stories.name: cloudfoundry/stack-auditor #6: Feature Request: optionally show the current buildpacks
stories.description:
[Github Issue #6](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/stack-auditor/issues/6)

>when upgrading to the latest stack its easy to see that some apps will be able to go easier than others. a lot of this can be determined by knowing the build pack. if the `audit-stack` command had an option to also show the buildpack of each application we could easily begin to identify low hanging fruit (like nginx buildpacks) and others that will require more research and consideration (buildpack is a git url) 

Filed by [@danlangford](http://github.com/danlangford)

**Notes**

Can output for audit stack look like the following:

`cf audit-stack`

output:

```
app                                        stack                    buildpack
pivotal/v0fnegtf/php_all                   cflinuxfs2               php
pivotal/v0fnegtf/php_app                   cflinuxfs2               php

```

stories.name: cloudfoundry/cflinuxfs3-release #5: cflinuxfs3-rootfs-setup pre-start is not idempotent
stories.description:
[Github Issue #5](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cflinuxfs3-release/issues/5)

>Hi,
>
>we have just noticed that the `pre-start` script of the `cflinuxfs3-rootfs-setup` job is not idempotent. It can happen under certain circumstances that BOSH runs the script twice which leads to the following error:
>```
> CONF_DIR=/var/vcap/jobs/cflinuxfs3-rootfs-setup/config
>+ ROOTFS_PACKAGE=/var/vcap/packages/cflinuxfs3
>+ ROOTFS_DIR=/var/vcap/packages/cflinuxfs3/rootfs
>+ ROOTFS_TAR=/var/vcap/packag ...(message has been trimmed)

Filed by [@fhambrec](http://github.com/fhambrec)

stories.name: cloudfoundry/cflinuxfs3 #10: Provide graphviz + Dependencies
stories.description:
[Github Issue #10](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cflinuxfs3/issues/10)

>Please consider adding the graphviz package plus its dependencies to the stack. https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/graphviz
>
>It would be nice to have it, so PlantUML can be executed in Cloud Foundry.
>Weve done this with cflinuxfs2, but cflinuxfs3 is missing several dependencies for graphwiz, so plantuml can not be used to its full potential.

stories.name: cloudfoundry/php-buildpack #265: Enable opcache by default
stories.description:
[Github Issue #265](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/php-buildpack/issues/265)

>Opcache can be used to decrease CPU usage at the expense of increased memory usage (up to 64mb by default), and it is normally recommended to run with opcache enabled for maximum performance. The default configuration of opcache is pretty conservative and it is unlikely to cause problems - especially in immutable applications.
>

stories.name: cloudfoundry/php-buildpack #302: NOTICE: End of support for Nginx versions 1.14.x after 2019-05-30
stories.description:
[Github Issue #302](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/php-buildpack/issues/302)

>The first release of the Php buildpack after May 30, 2019 will no longer include any versions of Nginx 1.14.x. Please migrate your Php apps to supported versions of Nginx before that time. 
>
>Note: Unless you are manually specifying a version of Nginx for the buildpack to use, or you have customized your Php buildpack, no action is required.
>

Filed by [@shanks3012](http://github.com/shanks3012)

stories.description:
[Github Issue #15](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/nginx-buildpack/issues/15)

>

>
